titleStmt.title: Authoris ad librum suum carmen Ouidianum, cum diutina febri rure laboraret.
titleStmt.author: Oxon, A.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: Authoris ad librum suum carmen Ouidianum, cum diutina febri rure laboraret.
analytic.author: Oxon, A.

monogr.title: Alcida : Greenes metamorphosis, vvherein is discouered, a pleasant transformation of bodies into sundrie shapes, shewing that as vertues beautifie the mind, so vanities giue greater staines, than the perfection of any quality can rase out: the discourse confirmed with diuers merry and delightfull histories; full of graue principles to content age, and sawsed with pleasant parlees, and witty answeres, to satisfie youth: profitable for both, and not offensiue to any. By R.G
monogr.author: Greene, Robert

div.head: Authoris ad librum suum carmen Ouidianum, cum diutina febri rure laboraret.
div.l: Parue (ne •… inuideo) sine me liber ibis in vrbem:
Hei mihi, quòd domino non licet ire tuo.
Et palma tu dignus, & hic, & quisquis in altam,
Pluribus vt prosit, doctus descendit arenam.
